text: Oh I see. My apologies, seems we got the wrong end of the stick then! Thank you for your help

Hi Team

I'm using a Private App to perform various actions on a client's HubSpot a/c. In some of the requests made through the App, I'm getting HTTP 400 errors. Adding a few request Ids for reference.

• 2ca5028f-52c8-47a4-b5ec-711752a584fa
• b6d875f1-6a29-4b52-ac93-46184655db67
• 3df90966-306a-4003-a44a-ee516f83ce7a
The error message shows that the value sent in the payload is not one of the available options (properties are of multi-select type). But I've sent the exact same value as defined & shown in the property on HubSpot.

Help on this would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks
Yep, you're good. No need to change anything with those apis
Obviously you're using the api but are you setting that body type as formdata?
and you are specifying the values of the options not the labels right?
Yes
Hi team, Any idea how to display list of all deals  by Pipeline ID as  API endpoint I cant seem find the endpoint with displaying the deals under pipelineID

:wave: Hi guys! I have a question. How many rows you can create using a HUBDB API? is there any limit?
``` request: /cms/v3/hubdb/tables/{tableIdOrName}/rows/draft/batch/create```

I would image it's either:
10,
or 10000 because thats the max you can have in a hubdb
Unfortunately the docs don't specify the limit.
Trial and error I guess
Yeah, as I dig into the documentation it don't have any  information about it. Anyway, thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>
for sure, let me know what you find

All contacts are saved with their marketing data and sources properly (using HubSpot web analytics tracking) until a month ago. Each contact is saved with additional info from our backend server. 
However, suddenly all contacts saved sources was changed to "Offline sources" and "API" and marketing data such as utm parameters was lost.

Basically no code added or modified that related to that logic. No sure what might couse this issue. 

If anyone here has a clue I will be thankful.

Random question of the day: does anyone know why tickets are under the “Standard” scope, but all other CRM objects are under the “crm.objects” parent scope? I discovered this while following the guide for switching from API keys to private apps. It threw me a bit that tickets weren’t lumped in with all other CRM objects, even though they are listed as CRM objects in the docs. Just feels oddly inconsistent.
